intro: Maerua nuda, commonly known as the naked maerua, is a small shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, smooth, often hairless leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Maerua nuda is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
